cause.description:
Retinoblastoma is an eye cancer of early childhood.It is a tumor that occurs in the retina, the light - sensitive lining of the eye. The most common symptom is an abnormal appearance of a pupil, which tends to reflect light as a white reflex, like a cat's eye. This is usually only visible to the naked eye in low artificial lighting, or in photographs where a flash has been used. This cancer only affects children under 5 years old. It is very rare, only 50 children will be diagnosed with retinoblastoma in the UK each year. Over 95% of children will survive after treatment. So if anyone takes a picture of anyone under 5 and their pupil looks whie in the photo, please take them to your GP ASAP to get them checked out!
For more information go to www.chect.org.uk
This is dedicated to my daughter Isha Tavares and Carenza Thomas
1. Help raise awareness
2. Early detection is the key
3. To prevent other children loosing their eyes
cause.mission: Raise awareness of this rare eye cancer in order to promote early diagnosis
